Articles.Content: After fidling around in the hangar after .15 came out and after some trial and error I ca present SR-15 my 15th spaceplane iteration. It is a fully reuseable SSTO spaceplane with some margin for orbital maneuvers. I\'m considering strap on RATO boosters though it\'s bit of a lug on the takeoff.
Very clean. I like. I really haven\'t done much mixing of engine types - it honestly didn\'t occur to me. But now...
I\'m having a little trouble with it tumbling once I engage the LFEs. Any tips for takeoff? What procedure to you follow to achieve orbit? I like the design!
Me too, honestly, im having a hard time getting it off the runway.

What I do is, I take off, Climb to 14,000 metres at a heading of 90 degrees, With my nose pointed around 50 or 60 degrees upwards, Once my effiency levels get below 0.20 I activate the Rocket engines and deactivate the atmosphereic engines, I get my Apoapis to up around 120,000 and then make my orbit more circular. As for the fuel and take off problems, See the 'diagram attached'
